meanings.definition: The belief that natural objects, natural phenomena, and the universe itself possess souls or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: Animism teaches that everything in nature has a spirit.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient cultures practiced animism, believing in the spirits of trees and rivers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of animism can make a walk in the forest feel like a journey among friends.
meanings.sent4: In the world of animism, the wind whispers secrets to those who listen closely.
meanings.sent5: The concept of animism brings a magical quality to the world around us.

meanings.definition: The attribution of a soul to plants, inanimate objects, and natural phenomena.
meanings.sent1: Animism sees life in the flowers and rocks.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures believe in animism, giving personalities to mountains and stars.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where animism is true, and your favorite chair has feelings.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of animism, the moon is not just a rock in the sky but a celestial being.
meanings.sent5: The concept of animism invites us to see the world through empathetic eyes.
